examples: I put on a clean pair of socks every morning.
He's just putting on an act for the boss's benefit.
He put on his leather jacket before heading out on his motorcycle.
He was always putting on airs and graces.
She put on her swimsuit and jumped into the pool.
words.defineEn: to put a piece of clothing on one's or someone else's body
words.defineVi: để đặt một mảnh quần áo trên cơ thể của một người hoặc người khác

examples: He asked for her hand in marriage.
Did your friend ask for permission to use the image?
Leaving your valuables in plain sight in your car is asking for a break-in.
They will be asking for it.
They asked for his last name at the hotel check-in, to confirm his reservation.
words.defineEn: to state that one wants to see or speak to someone specific
words.defineVi: để nói rằng một người muốn xem hoặc nói chuyện với ai đó cụ thể

examples: I wanted the floor to open up and swallow me.
We were having a picnic in the park when the heavens opened up and we had to rush for cover.
At that moment the boss walked in, and I just wanted the ground to open up and swallow me.
You need to go through channels to get the job that is opening up at our company.
After weeks of studying, it was like the heavens opened up when he aced the exam.
words.defineEn: to open a locked door, container, etc.
words.defineVi: để mở một cánh cửa bị khóa, thùng chứa, v.v.

examples: It really gets up my nose.
He's just getting up my nose so much at the moment.
He got up on the wrong side of the bed this morning.
You, the night owl, are getting up at 5 AM tomorrow?
I got up and looked out of the window.
words.defineEn: to wake up and get out of bed
words.defineVi: thức dậy và ra khỏi giường

examples: I was put in charge of the office.
"Thy advice, this night, I'll put in practice."
If you want to learn a new skill, you have to put in the time and effort.
Thank you for putting in a word for me.
Andrews' favorite waitress means well when she puts in a good word for him with Tierney.
words.defineEn: to place an object into position or into another object
words.defineVi: để đặt một đối tượng vào vị trí hoặc vào đối tượng khác

examples: I woke up with the mother of all hangovers.
They usually wake up at 7 o'clock on weekdays.
She woke up and found herself in a hospital bed.
We woke up early and took a dip in the sea before breakfast.
I wake up early every morning to go for a run.
words.defineEn: to no longer be asleep
words.defineVi: không còn buồn ngủ

examples: Time is moving on.
The government has not moved on this issue.
Things have moved on a lot since the days when I was young.
So, I moved on, focused on myself, and eventually found someone who treated me better.
We were able to clean it up and move on.
words.defineEn: to accept a change or a new situation and be ready to continue with your life and deal with new experiences, especially after a bad experience such as a breakup
words.defineVi: chấp nhận một sự thay đổi hoặc một tình huống mới và sẵn sàng tiếp tục cuộc sống của bạn và đối phó với những trải nghiệm mới, đặc biệt là sau một trải nghiệm tồi tệ như chia tay

examples: If the child doesn't get what he wants, he immediately turns on the waterworks.
The closet had a light that automatically turned on when the door was opened.
I accidentally spilled water on my laptop, and now it won't turn on.
I turned on the air conditioner because it was getting too hot inside.
"Turn on?"
words.defineEn: to cause a machine, device, or equipment to operate, typically by pushing a button or turning a key
words.defineVi: để làm cho máy móc, thiết bị hoặc thiết bị hoạt động, thường bằng cách nhấn nút hoặc xoay chìa khóa

examples: Pointing out that many health problems stem from poor diet and overeating.
When discussing the limitations of artificial intelligence, I point out that even the most advanced algorithms can make mistakes, for even Homer nods.
The celebrity was quick to judge others for their fashion choices, but someone pointed out that he had been caught wearing a similar outfit a few years ago.
You were all over your sister about her eating habits, but you start pouting when I point out that you had a cupcake for dinner last night!
The argument that the company's products were environmentally friendly had more holes than Swiss cheese, and critics pointed out several inconsistencies in their claims.
words.defineEn: to show something to someone by pointing one's finger towards it
words.defineVi: để hiển thị một cái gì đó cho ai đó bằng cách chỉ ngón tay của một người về phía nó

examples: The lion's roar can be heard from miles away, establishing its dominance.
You can expect to hear from my attorney.
Senators heard from the top security officials during the attack.
Senators heard from five crucial nominees, amid security concerns on the eve of the inauguration.
The Veterans Affairs Committee heard from Denis McDonough, nominee for Veterans Affairs secretary.
words.defineEn: to be contacted by someone, usually by letter, email, or phone call
words.defineVi: được ai đó liên lạc, thường là bằng thư, email hoặc gọi điện thoại

examples: Get out!
Word got out about the surprise party, and it wasn't a surprise anymore.
A car drives up, and a man gets out.
A car drove up to us and a man got out.
A fool may throw a stone into a well which a hundred wise men cannot get out.
words.defineEn: to leave somewhere such as a room, building, etc.
words.defineVi: để rời khỏi một nơi nào đó chẳng hạn như một căn phòng, tòa nhà, vv

examples: The old man gave up the ghost.
My poor old car finally gave up the ghost.
Ours has finally given up the ghost.
Er, don't give up the day job!
We gave up the right to use the valley.
words.defineEn: to stop trying when faced with failures or difficulties
words.defineVi: ngừng cố gắng khi đối mặt với thất bại hoặc khó khăn

words.defineEn: to carefully check something
words.defineVi: để kiểm tra cẩn thận một cái gì đó

examples: She often gets on her soapbox about environmental issues.
she gets on the stick very quickly.
It really gets on my nerves.
They got on bad terms after an argument.
Don't get on your high horse with me.
words.defineEn: to enter a bus, ship, airplane, etc.
words.defineVi: để vào xe buýt, tàu, máy bay, v.v.

examples: The couple's marriage turned into a cat-and-dog life.
The mortgage on it has turned into a real yoke round my neck.
What began as a minor scuffle turned into a full-scale riot.
I left a jar of milk on the counter overnight, and it turned into clabber.
But a security guard catches them in the act and simple theft turns into capital murder.
words.defineEn: to change and become something else
words.defineVi: để thay đổi và trở thành một cái gì đó khác

examples: The company has brought in some new blood in an effort to revive its fortunes.
This company badly needs to bring in some new blood.
but they had been brought in on a case that seemed to have a supernatural barrier.
Allowing people to bring in large bags is a risk as far as safety is concerned.
When my father saw a clear moonlit sky in the evening, he always warned us that 'clear moon, frost soon' and advised us to bring in any plants that might be damaged by frost.
words.defineEn: to move someone or something indoors
words.defineVi: để di chuyển một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó trong nhà

examples: You want to hang out and shoot some hoops for a while?
She started hanging out with a few rotten eggs in her school, and her grades have really suffered ever since.
Many parents warn their children about the dangers of hanging out with the wrong crowd, often saying if you lie down with dogs, you will get up with fleas.
If Toxina wants to keep hanging out with your mom, hey, she can knock herself out.
Then, herpes basically hangs out.
words.defineEn: to spend much time in a specific place or with someone particular
words.defineVi: dành nhiều thời gian ở một nơi cụ thể hoặc với một ai đó cụ thể

examples: He told me to go away.
His friends soon go away.
Go away!’
'Go away!'
Go away!'
words.defineEn: to leave or travel away from a place or a person
words.defineVi: để rời khỏi hoặc đi du lịch từ một nơi hoặc một người

examples: The west is often associated with notions of freedom and adventure.
Charlie shouldn’t have associated with those people.

While all forms of speech are valuable and deserve respect, some varieties are associated with more power and prestige - a language is a dialect with an army and navy, so be aware of the political factors that influence our perceptions of language.
The distinctive smell of decaying gulfweed is often associated with coastal areas.
Laura was incapable of doing anything by halves and she did not allow those associated with her to act otherwise.
words.defineEn: to spend time with someone or a group of people
words.defineVi: dành thời gian với ai đó hoặc một nhóm người

examples: When the police informer saw a friend, he took off like a rat up a drainpipe.
He will make a fortune if his invention takes off.
I watched the planes take off and land from the observation deck at the airport.
I always feel excited when the airplane takes off.
He was embarrassed by his moobs while taking off his shirt at the beach.
words.defineEn: to remove a piece of clothing from one's or another's body
words.defineVi: để loại bỏ một mảnh quần áo từ cơ thể của một hoặc người khác

examples: I entirely agree with you.
With all due respect, Sir, I cannot agree with your last statement.
I don't always agree with my best friend, but we still manage to get on famously.
The old saying goes that silence is a woman's best garment, but I don't agree with that.
If I don't agree with that five-year deadline, you start thrusting it down my throat.
words.defineEn: to approve or accept something as good, moral, etc.
words.defineVi: để phê duyệt hoặc chấp nhận một cái gì đó là tốt, đạo đức, vv

examples: As a vegetarian, she often turned to cowpea salads for a protein-packed dish.
He turned to us and gave a big smile.
Looking for another string to his bow, he turned to art and design, for which he had always shown a talent.
He started life as a teacher before turning to journalism.
Whenever I feel the need for inspiration or escape, I turn to a book, which, as the proverb goes, is like a garden carried in the pocket.
words.defineEn: to get advice or help from someone
words.defineVi: để có được lời khuyên hoặc giúp đỡ từ một ai đó

examples: The heating system is always breaking down.
It has broken down almost every day this week.
My dad gave me a ride to school when my car broke down.
They had already had a good time on the ride before it broke down.
It’s Sod’s law that the car breaks down when you need it most.
words.defineEn: (of a machine or vehicle) to stop working as a result of a defect
words.defineVi: (của máy móc hoặc phương tiện) ngừng hoạt động do lỗi

examples: The keys are kept in my office.
He keeps in good trim by going to the gym three times a week.
Samantha has been keeping in trim by practicing yoga and meditation.
They moved away five years ago, but we still keep in touch.
When considering whether or not to start a family, it's important to keep in mind that children are certain cares but uncertain comforts and be prepared for the challenges of parenting.
words.defineEn: to not let someone leave a particular place
words.defineVi: để không để ai đó rời khỏi một nơi cụ thể

examples: I’ve never heard of any of these restaurants.
I won't hear of you dropping out of school.

As he heard of a friend's misfortune, he remembered the saying 'there but for the grace of God go I,' acknowledging that he too could have faced similar difficulties if not for the blessings in his life.
She won't hear of anyone using her computer without permission.
After having a dream about attending a funeral, my friend recalled the old saying dream of a funeral and you hear of a marriage, and wondered if it was a sign of good news to come.
words.defineEn: to be informed of something; or to know about or be aware of the existence of someone or something
words.defineVi: được thông báo về một cái gì đó; hoặc để biết về hoặc nhận thức được sự tồn tại của một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó
